title: 111_hr5018
content: The "Government Audit Reform Act of 2010" requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to implement recommendations from the Government Accountability Office report on improving the Single Audit process. The "Government Audit Reform Act of 2010" mandates oversight and evaluation of the implementation of the Single Audit Act by Federal agencies to improve efficiency and effectiveness. The Director must monitor and report to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate. The Government Audit Reform Act of 2010 requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to designate an oversight entity to report findings annually to specific committees. The Government Audit Reform Act of 2010 mandates the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to appoint an oversight entity to report yearly findings to designated committees. The resources allocated to the entity must be sufficient for effective implementation of the Act. The Government Audit Reform Act of 2010 requires oversight and evaluation of the single audit process to identify simplified alternatives for small recipients while maintaining accountability. A report must be submitted within 6 months. The Government Audit Reform Act of 2010 mandates evaluation of the single audit process for small recipients, with a report due within 6 months to specified committees and the Comptroller General. Definitions for "Director" and "large recipient" are provided. The term "non-Federal entity" refers to an organization that spends over $300,000 in Federal awards, while a "small recipient" spends less than that amount. These definitions are important for the implementation of recommendations to enhance audit quality. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will evaluate and report on the implementation of recommendations to improve audit quality, as outlined in the President's Council on Integrity and Efficiency report. The report will be submitted to specific committees and the Comptroller General within 6 months of the enactment of the Act. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must designate an oversight entity within 60 days of the Act's enactment.
